reviewText: as this was a midseason replacement with only 8 episodes, it's expected there would be some rough patches.  i have no idea whether or not this was planned to be a long-running series.  i truly hated archie bunker and had a hard time seeing carroll o'connor as anything but him, but i came across this show one day and watched it and just fell in love with it.the character development was a bit rushed in these 8 episodes, but believable, and the show became very cohesive, very quickly.i've quickly scanned through all the reviews and did not see an episode listing of exactly what is on this DVD set.  i should get mine today, so i can confirm the details, but here is the list from imdb.compilot part 1pilot part 2road killfateblind spot part 1blind spot part 2a necessary evil...and then you dieagain, this is NOT the list from the DVD set, so please be aware of that.UPDATED 13 JUN:  all the episodes are included in the 2-disc set.

reviewText: At last the powers that be finally gave us season 1 of this wonderful series.With top notch acting, rivoting stories and a look at the south as it was in the 60's and 70's.This series picks up where the movie ends and has a grittiness not found in other shows of this type. If you have seen the movie you already know what to expect and If you have seen this series you will remember it fondly, after all who could forget Bubba { the wonderful Alan Autry }. For those who have not seen this show I urge you to give it a try it won't disappoint.

reviewText: In the heat of the Night is a favorite series and I'm excited to receive all the seasons.  Season 1 is not my favorite because the characters were not fully developed and because of where it was filmed.  The remainder of the entire series was filmed in Covington, GA - a beautiful, quaint city and all the lovely homes, courthouse, town square, hospital, schools and churches really exist.  I hope that all the seasons will be available.

reviewText: When I heard that a company named TGG Direct was getting ready to re-issue this series for the first time on DVD, I couldn't believe it. Forever grateful this show we loved back then is here to stay. Hope to God they do the same on the following seasons plus TV movies. I still keep another copy of the show with me today just months prior to TGG re-issue this following with the first season.Back to the show, what I love about it is the entire cast and crew is phenomenal plus the music background and scoring is great. God rest Carroll O'Connor, Howard Rollins and Hugh O'Connor whom remain a great part in the show. TGG did a good job putting it all together. Another thing there's no special features added like any dvd commentaries, featurettes or nothing. Other than that, it's all good.If you to get the real scoop about this series, recommend checking the movie versions also likeIn the Heat of the Night (40th Anniversary Collector's Edition),They Call Me Mister Tibbs!,The Organizationand yes the scores from Quincy Jones for these two moviesIn The Heat Of The Night (1967 Film) / They Call Me Mister Tibbs! (1970 Film): Original MGM Motion Picture Soundtrack [Enhanced CD] and Gil Melle too forThe Organization [Soundtrack] or"THE ORGANIZATION"ORIGINAL MOTION PICTURE SCORE.
summary: One of the Best TV Shows ever I grew up on!!!

reviewText: I was so glad to see the 1st season of "In the Heat of the Night" on dvd and ordered immediately. I'd never seen the pilot episodes and it made me love the series much more. The acting is superb and the scenes are intense.  Carroll O'Connor does a great job as a small town Sheriff Gillespie upholding order when he's forced to add homocide detective Virgil Tibs to his department to solve a murder.Can't wait for the next episodes to come out, if ever.  The only down side of ordering the 1st season is they may finally come out with the whole series.

reviewText: I used to watch this series with my grandparents when I was growing up.  We all looked forward to it every week.  Watching it now with my kids brings back all those good memories, and it's still as timeless and enjoyable as it was then.  If you liked this series when it was on the air, you really need to buy it.  If you missed it when it aired previously, you have got to see it now.  I was never a Carroll O'Connor fan -- hated the other shows he was in, then this series started and I loved him in it!  He plays the perfect Good ol' boy chief, and of course who can resist "Bubba"!  I can't wait for them to release season 2 on DVD.

reviewText: In The Heat Of The Night is a 1988 television series based on a film and a novel and stars Carrol 'O Connor as the quick witted Chief Bill Gillespie along with his adopted son Hugh as Lonnie Jamison. The series is nothing short of brilliant and is deeply engaging. Much like it's source, it centers around the extremely rural city of Sparta, Mississippi, it's police force, and the crooks who think they can get away with it.The show dealt with some pretty heavy handed issues such as rape, government corruption, homophobia, and racism. Fairly forward thinking considering that it came out two years before the extremely successful Law & Order series.
summary: Big Crime In The Tiny Town Of Sparta

reviewText: I was delighted to finally see this Series released on DVD.  I had never heard of TGG Direct but this was a no brainer for me since this is one of my favorite programs.  I have only watched the first disc so far, however the picture and audio quality seem to be just fine.  I did notice a few little minor irritants.  First of all the artwork on the front is a little grainy (I am confused by the large city silouhette located on a large body of water depicted under the cast photo), they used plain black cases similar to those used for single DVD releases, and the DVD labels look like something one could make at home.  Also a little annoying, you can choose a show from the main menu however after the show you select is done the next episode strarts playing as a DVD with "play all" option would rather than going back to the main menu.  More annoying, the episode play time does not start at 0 seconds except for the first episode on each disc as it normally would.  For example if episode one was 49:26 mins episode 2 would start at 49:27 and if episode 2 were 48:00 mins episode 3 would start at 1 39:28 thus you really don't have any idea if the episode is almost done or not (I like to have and idea).  Naturally the packaging is not up to major studio standards, but TGG Direct came though where it counts releasing this show with good picture quality.  I hope they follow up with the rest of the Season sets priced reasonably as they did with this one.
summary: In the Heat of the Night at last
